info.name: FAKESTOREAPI
info.description:
Overview
This collection demonstrates a simple end-to-end workflow using the public reqres.in sample API: fetch a list of resources, create a user, and update that user. It’s intended for practicing basic HTTP operations in Postman.

Base URL
- https://reqres.in
- Recommended variable: {{baseUrl}} (default: https://reqres.in)
  • Define {{baseUrl}} in an environment to easily switch hosts if needed.

Authentication
- None required. reqres.in is a public demo API and does not need authentication.

Environments & Variables
- Create an environment (e.g., "Reqres Demo") and add: baseUrl = https://reqres.in
- Optional runtime variables captured during the flow: userId, createdAt, updatedAt.
- Reference URLs as {{baseUrl}}/api/... so you can reuse or change the base in one place.

Requests in this collection
1) List resources — GET /api/unknown
   - Purpose: Retrieve a list of “unknown” resources (a sample dataset provided by reqres.in).
   - Required params: none
   - Optional query params: page (number) — paginates results (e.g., ?page=2)
   - Expected 200 OK response body:
     {
       "page": 1,
       "per_page": 6,
       "total": 12,
       "total_pages": 2,
       "data": [ { "id": 1, "name": "cerulean", "year": 2000 } ]
     }
   - Common errors: 404 Not Found (for non-existent routes)

2) Create user — POST /api/users
   - Purpose: Create a new user (demo only; data is not persisted).
   - Required JSON body:
     {
       "name": "morpheus",
       "job": "leader"
     }
   - Expected 201 Created response body includes id and createdAt:
     {
       "name": "morpheus",
       "job": "leader",
       "id": "123",
       "createdAt": "2025-01-01T00:00:00.000Z"
     }
   - Common errors: 400 Bad Request (malformed JSON)

3) Replace user — PUT /api/users/:id
   - Purpose: Replace an existing user’s details (demo behavior; changes are echoed back).
   - Required path param: id (e.g., 2)
   - Typical JSON body (optional for demo API but recommended):
     {
       "name": "morpheus",
       "job": "zion resident"
     }
   - Expected 200 OK response body includes updatedAt.

4) Update user — PATCH /api/users/:id
   - Purpose: Partially update an existing user (demo behavior; changes are echoed back).
   - Required path param: id (e.g., 2)
   - Typical JSON body:
     {
       "job": "rebel leader"
     }
   - Expected 200 OK response body includes updatedAt.

Example usage snippets
- cURL
  # List resources
  curl --request GET "{{baseUrl}}/api/unknown" -H "Accept: application/json"

  # Create user
  curl --request POST "{{baseUrl}}/api/users" \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --data '{"name":"morpheus","job":"leader"}'

  # Replace user
  curl --request PUT "{{baseUrl}}/api/users/2" \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --data '{"name":"morpheus","job":"zion resident"}'

  # Update user
  curl --request PATCH "{{baseUrl}}/api/users/2" \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --data '{"job":"rebel leader"}'

Notes
- This is a demo API: data is not persisted.
- You can run the collection with the Collection Runner or a Monitor to see all steps end-to-end.
